hackathon-eligibility: You must be an employee of some sort (full time, intern or contract) or invited to directly to particpate alognside an employee. If you plan to invite a non-Wayfair employee please email Sam Wickman directly.
hackathon-requirements: Project descriptions and screen shots are due no later than 9 AM on Sunday the 16th. Preliminary judging schedule will be communicated by 5:00 PM that evening. You must submit your project along with your team name and team members name to the DevPost site to qualify. If you have issues doing this please email Sam Wickman directly.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Project that could most likely be used by Wayfair in the future.
Best Project to demonstrate a creative or groundbreaking use of technology.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=800 Boylston St, Boston, MA 02199, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-description-header: Join us for Wayfair's 5th Annual Employee Hackathon!
